conference: International Conference on Object-Oriented Programming, Systems, Languages and Applications
notes: Two-stage review process: after the PC meetings, all non-rejected papers are conditionally accepted, with a 5-week period to address mandatory revisions. All accepted papers are published in the ACM PACMPL journal, which is Gold open access. The review process is 'lightweight' double blind in the sense that authors don't need to hide their identities too hard (e.g., not pre-posting their work). See more at https://2017.splashcon.org/track/splash-2017-OOPSLA#FAQ-on-Double-Blind-Reviewing. In addition to the PC, there's an ERC with 20-30 members, which evaluated the 10 PC papers (4 accepted). Six papers got a 'distinguished paper' award and five got a 'distinguished artifact', with one overlap (all of them tagged as 'award' below). The PC has 50% women, and 2 of 3 keynotes, but still working on distribution of service roles. The review process is 'light' double-blind in the sense that author identities are revealed after the review is complete to allow for correcting misconception of prior work and resolve previously unknown conflicts. Diversity: Chair's welcome talks about making the PC 50% women and 2/3 keynote speakers; Childcare; Code of conduct.
pc_members: Gabriel Dos Reis (Texas A&M University tamu, Microsoft)
Doug Lea (State University of New York SUNY Oswego)
Heather Miller (Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne EPFL)
Sasa Misailovic (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, USA)
